name: Kasbah Omar

reviews.title: Karim makes this place a special location
reviews.text: We also stayed in the Ourika Valley (not sure why it is categorized as in Marrakesh) with an Access trips tour. It is newly refurbished, and nicely appointed. We were initially taken aback with the classic Riad architecture which affords no windows facing outward to take advantage of the view or to receive much natural light.Our room was large but very dark. Decor stays true to the region. Details like the bathroom are "interesting" but clean.

reviews.title: Superb gem nestled into a Berber village
reviews.text: The rooftop restaurant/lounge is a great feature. It offers sweeping views of the valley and encouraged our group to congregate, get to know each other and bond. It was a spectacular setting to our wonderful cooking classes and dinners. The food was wonderful.

reviews.title: 3 of 1001 nights
reviews.text: But what made this a fabulous stay was Karim. His warmth and positive hospitality made our visit to the valley a special one. He does everything with a smile. We hiked to the Mon. market (WOW!) to shop for our cooking class. The hike up to the waterfall was fabulous. Karim was a knowledgeable, helpful, considerate and fun guide!

reviews.title: Charm, Beauty, Service and Fun!
reviews.text: Once in a while, you land in the right place, with just the right traveling companions, cared for by just the right host. Here at Kasbah Omar, that special someone is Karim, who seemed to be everywhere all the time with anything we might need. Kasbah Omar is warm and welcoming, from the unique decor of the individual rooms to the terrace where, on a culinary tour, we cooked while watching the sun set on our beautiful view of the mountains. Karim translated for our Moroccan chef as she taught us to make several dishes, escorted us to the Monday market, accompanied us on hikes and sightseeing tours and was just as charming and kind a host as you would wish for. Whether it was a wake up knock at the door or an extra bottle of water or arranging for a donkey to walk along with us as we hiked to the market, Karim was just phenomenal.

reviews.title: Best place to stay in Anrar!
reviews.text: I spent 3nts here with an Access Trips culinary tour. What a magical wonderful place--location and building. Close to Marrakech and all the fun of Ourika Valley, it's perfectly located in the shade of the Atlas Mountains. Nestled in a quiet Berber village you can meander around with ease. The food is wonderful as well. Kareem is a great host, I felt always in competent and warm hands. One of the highlights of my stay was just sitting and reading, so comfortable in this beautiful Kasbah.

description: A new luxury Kasbah with an ancient soul located in the cool heart of the Atlas Mountains. Just a short drive from the Marrakech Medina.
